metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1938 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The s_mp_div function in lib/freebl/mpi/mpi.c in Mozilla Network SecurityServices (NSS) before 3.21, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 44.0,improperly divides numbers, which might make it easier for remote attackersto defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms by leveraging use of the (1)mp_div or (2) mp_exptmod function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.21-1ubuntu2
libnss3-1d - 2:3.21-1ubuntu2
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.21-1ubuntu2
libnss3-tools - 2:3.21-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
nss package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.21-1ubuntu2').
